definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Every summer, mother puts up a large quantity of vegetables for us to eat during the winter.
sentences.chinese: 每年夏天母親都要醃大量鹹菜到冬天食用。

sentences.english: I ask her, Aunt Zhang, your family also floods the brined vegetable?
sentences.chinese: 我問她，張阿姨，你家還淹鹹菜嗎？

sentences.english: He likes to have rice and pickles for meals.
He said that he would rather eat pickled vegetables, to save money to buy cigarettes smoking.
sentences.chinese: 他說，他寧願喫鹹菜，也要省下錢來買菸抽。

sentences.english: My mother when I am pregnant, eat pickles.
sentences.chinese: 我媽懷我的時候，常喫鹹菜。

sentences.english: The longer to pickle it, the more delicious it would be.
sentences.chinese: 在更長的時間才能鹹菜它，更將是美味。

sentences.english: This jar of old marinade can be used next time. Don't pour it away.
sentences.chinese: 這罈子老湯下次醃鹹菜時還可以用，不要倒掉。

sentences.english: The pickles, warm stomach, warm heart.
Grandma loved haw-pickled cabbage the most.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶最愛喫紅果兒淹漬的鹹菜。

definition: plain cooked rice/rice with nothing to go with it
to soak cooked rice in soup or water/cooked rice reheated in boiling water
